title: FIA: Fluorescence Image Aligner - Dual-Engine Motion Correction for ImageJ/Fiji (v3.0.0)
description:
FIA (Fluorescence Image Aligner) v3.0.0 is a major milestone release introducing a revolutionary Dual-Engine Architecture for robust motion correction in fluorescence microscopy. This version bridges the gap between high-precision rigid alignment and robust large-displacement stabilization.

v3.0.0 Highlights: The "Dual-Engine" Update
This release integrates two powerful registration kernels into a unified, smart interface, allowing users to tackle everything from subtle sub-pixel jitter to severe sample drift and deformation.

Key Features:

  • üöÄ Dual-Engine Architecture:
    • OpenCV ECC (Default): Provides sub-pixel precision for rigid body transformations (Translation/Euclidean/Affine), ideal for high-quality functional imaging data.
    • Legacy Stabilizer (New): A full Java port of the classic Lucas-Kanade algorithm (based on Kang Li's Image Stabilizer). It offers superior robustness against large displacements where gradient-based methods might fail.
  • üåä Elastic Registration (New): Introduces a dense Optical Flow (Farneback) mode to correct non-rigid deformations, such as tissue growth, squashing, or complex biological warping.
  • ‚öì Dynamic Anchor Strategy: Implements a "What You See Is What You Anchor" philosophy. Users can now set the alignment reference to the currently viewed frame (e.g., Frame 50), automatically registering past and future frames to this optimal timepoint.
  • üß† Smart UI & Workflow:
    • Context-Aware Interface: Parameter panels automatically hide/show based on the selected engine and mode to reduce clutter.
    • Biosensor Tool Integration: Now organized under the standardized Biosensor Tool menu for better discoverability.
    • Rolling Reference: The Legacy engine supports a customizable update coefficient (default 0.90) for smooth, steady-cam style stabilization.
  • üõ°Ô∏è Non-Destructive & Quantitative: Continues to prioritize data integrity by generating new stacks without altering raw files, and offers CSV export of transformation matrices for trajectory analysis.
